alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 6:54PM MST until July 05 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 652 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the Labyrinth Canyon drainage. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Labyrinth Canyon. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Labyrinth Canyon in Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. This includes the following slot canyons... Labyrinth Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
